meanings.def: not supporting or helping either side in a disagreement, competition, etc.
examples: Journalists are supposed to be politically neutral.
I didn't take my father's or my mother's side; I tried to remain neutral.
Our actions are never culturally neutral.
The government maintained its strictly neutral policy.
The meeting must be at a politically neutral location.
neutral about this issue
Very few journalists are politically neutral.
When my parents split up I tried to remain neutral.

meanings.def: not belonging to any of the countries that are involved in a war; not supporting any of the countries involved in a war
examples: neutral territory/waters
Switzerland was neutral during the war.
The Russians took a broadly neutral position.
The UN are sending six neutral observers to the talks.

meanings.def: deliberately not expressing any strong feeling
examples: ‘So you told her?’ he said in a neutral tone of voice.
Dolly kept her voice carefully neutral.
Her expression seemed neutral.
He believes that technology is morally neutral until it is applied.

meanings.def: not very bright or strong, such as grey or light brown
examples: a neutral colour scheme
Neutral tones will give the room a feeling of space.
She chose fairly neutral make-up.
Her clothes were neutral in colour.

meanings.def: having neither a positive nor a negative electrical charge
examples: the neutral wire in a plug

meanings.def: in a place that has no connection with either of the people or sides who are meeting and so does not give an advantage to either of them
examples: We decided to meet on neutral ground.

idioms.def: in a place that has no connection with either of the people or sides who are meeting and so does not give an advantage to either of them
examples: We decided to meet on neutral ground.

meanings.def: the position of the gears of a vehicle in which no power is carried from the engine to the wheels
examples: in neutral to leave the car in neutral

meanings.def: a person or country that does not support either side in a disagreement, competition or war
a colour that is not bright or strong, such as grey or light brown
examples: The room was decorated in neutrals.
